channel.title: KenSmith tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from KenSmith.

item.description:
Universities disincentivize faculty from learning how to speak and write well for wide audiences.

In doing so, public universities give taxpayers less than they have paid for.

And some faculty grow vain: “Those people on the outside could never handle our best ideas . . .” https://t.co/R3JuFRGvh5
item.source:markdown:
Universities disincentivize faculty from learning how to speak and write well for wide audiences.
In doing so, public universities give taxpayers less than they have paid for.
And some faculty grow vain: “Those people on the outside could never handle our best ideas . . .” https://t.co/R3JuFRGvh5

item.description: An old memory came to mind, from about 1980. https://t.co/ok5KJPL3Zd
item.source:markdown: An old memory came to mind, from about 1980. https://t.co/ok5KJPL3Zd

item.description:
I was making a mental list of beautiful things while visiting Chicago last weekend. Fragile, vulnerable, may all be swept away, but undeniable things there in the city and its people.

Public art piece near Ukrainian Village, Chicago. https://t.co/6hmqpLTLPW
item.source:markdown:
I was making a mental list of beautiful things while visiting Chicago last weekend. Fragile, vulnerable, may all be swept away, but undeniable things there in the city and its people.
Public art piece near Ukrainian Village, Chicago. https://t.co/6hmqpLTLPW

item.description: By a roughly 3-to-2 margin, Kansas voters protect their access to abortion. https://t.co/A6IIIFxV9k
item.source:markdown: By a roughly 3-to-2 margin, Kansas voters protect their access to abortion. https://t.co/A6IIIFxV9k

item.description: How much we need strong regulatory agencies, skillful watchdog journalists, and activist citizens groups, and why we always will. https://t.co/H946RU805N
item.source:markdown: How much we need strong regulatory agencies, skillful watchdog journalists, and activist citizens groups, and why we always will. https://t.co/H946RU805N

item.description: “Americans were good at democracy because they practiced democracy.“ https://t.co/BBpSD14y6W
item.source:markdown: “Americans were good at democracy because they practiced democracy.“ https://t.co/BBpSD14y6W

item.description: Too far for the phone’s camera, but on our walk yesterday there was a bald eagle having a drink of water on the far bank of the St. Joseph River in South Bend, Indiana, right in town, a ten minute walk from the house. A first for our nearly three decades in this city. https://t.co/d7EcrZjgkt
item.source:markdown: Too far for the phone’s camera, but on our walk yesterday there was a bald eagle having a drink of water on the far bank of the St. Joseph River in South Bend, Indiana, right in town, a ten minute walk from the house. A first for our nearly three decades in this city. https://t.co/d7EcrZjgkt

item.description:
James Baldwin’s figurative language was so compact and insightful. Americans caught in “a labyrinth of attitudes,” unable to “renew themselves at the fountain of their lives…”

The Fire Next Time https://t.co/KeyBKagEFk
item.source:markdown:
James Baldwin’s figurative language was so compact and insightful. Americans caught in “a labyrinth of attitudes,” unable to “renew themselves at the fountain of their lives…”
The Fire Next Time https://t.co/KeyBKagEFk

item.description: Tired of supporting giant companies that aren’t especially good for society, but you still need to order books? Any of the country’s vital independent bookstores would be glad to help. https://t.co/aidWouLdel
item.source:markdown: Tired of supporting giant companies that aren’t especially good for society, but you still need to order books? Any of the country’s vital independent bookstores would be glad to help. https://t.co/aidWouLdel

item.description: “Only monsters would insist that doctors wait until women are so sick that they might die before they can receive appropriate medical treatment, which includes abortions.” https://t.co/YmkpBu1UUD
item.source:markdown: “Only monsters would insist that doctors wait until women are so sick that they might die before they can receive appropriate medical treatment, which includes abortions.” https://t.co/YmkpBu1UUD

item.description: Countdown to Hiroshima: Daily blog posts recount the final weeks and days of thought and action leading to the two atomic bombings, including the morally dubious political games being played in Washington. https://t.co/bTfLc5OTUc
item.source:markdown: Countdown to Hiroshima: Daily blog posts recount the final weeks and days of thought and action leading to the two atomic bombings, including the morally dubious political games being played in Washington. https://t.co/bTfLc5OTUc

item.description: "There is an urgent need for Americans to look deeply into themselves and their actions, and musical poetry is perhaps the most effective mirror available. Every newspaper headline is a potential song." --Phil Ochs https://t.co/Chhpw6DPMU
item.source:markdown: "There is an urgent need for Americans to look deeply into themselves and their actions, and musical poetry is perhaps the most effective mirror available. Every newspaper headline is a potential song." --Phil Ochs https://t.co/Chhpw6DPMU

item.description: "American poets are unaware of their own complicity in the dispensation and appropriation of acceptable bodies. I’m no longer spending my money where I have to rattle the doors to get in." https://t.co/RCFBitNU6G
item.source:markdown: "American poets are unaware of their own complicity in the dispensation and appropriation of acceptable bodies. I’m no longer spending my money where I have to rattle the doors to get in." https://t.co/RCFBitNU6G

item.description: Rhythm N Roots streams 9 to noon (Central) weekday mornings on KXCV-KRNW. Songs I never hear around northern Indiana. Some Zydeco, Cajun, hip Country, and I don't know what all. https://t.co/0j4GptqZaF
item.source:markdown: Rhythm N Roots streams 9 to noon (Central) weekday mornings on KXCV-KRNW. Songs I never hear around northern Indiana. Some Zydeco, Cajun, hip Country, and I don't know what all. https://t.co/0j4GptqZaF

item.description: "When you look back, his message was so humanistic, how could it possibly have seemed so radical? He was singing for equality and freedom and the end of war." --Michael Schumacher recalling Phil Ochs https://t.co/Chhpw6DPMU
item.source:markdown: "When you look back, his message was so humanistic, how could it possibly have seemed so radical? He was singing for equality and freedom and the end of war." --Michael Schumacher recalling Phil Ochs https://t.co/Chhpw6DPMU

item.description: Too much writing about rural life is done by someone standing on the far side of a five bar gate, said someone like Orwell. The principle applies widely.
item.source:markdown: Too much writing about rural life is done by someone standing on the far side of a five bar gate, said someone like Orwell. The principle applies widely.
